page.title: 03Local History
page.content: The people of Broomhaugh decided to get together some money to build a school and in 1828 Bridge Hill School was built. It had three rooms the school room and two rooms where the school master would have lived.The children did not have school meals.They used to play on the village square which was covered with grass and was later levelled and cobble stones were laid. But in 1871 a new school was built. It was bigger, it also had a flagged playground. This was used until the present school was built in 1967.
